title: For Trade:  Saiga AK-47 Survival Pack - Trade for your Pistol
postcontent:
Want to be ready for anything? Here's your chance to put away a complete package to hedge against zombies, the great New Madrid earthquake or an Obama law that makes AKs illegal for import. This is a Saiga AK that has been legally converted to take military magazines. If you don't know what a Saiga is, it's the only way to get a new, Russian-made AK-47 made in the same factory as Russian military rifles. Other AKs you see in the US are made in Croatia, or Bulgaria - eastern-bloc guns that are converted cheaply and crudely.

This AK features an ACE folding stock for easy storage and a Krebs peep rear sight - the best you can buy. Over $650 invested in the gun alone, not counting the 4 magazines or the ammo. All in all this package is worth well over $800. If our incumbent president is re-elected, the value may very well go up dramatically. If you don't own a high-cap fighting rifle, get one today!

ALSO includes 4 30-round mags and 500 rounds of ammo in an ammo can.

This AK is completely legal to own and is fully 922r compliant. Must be 18 yrs old and not a felon. You will need to provide an ID and verify that you are not a felon nor are barred from owning a rifle for any reason.

title: For Sale:  Sold - Rock River Arms Tactical Operator 2 - In stock!
postcontent:
KEELY ENTERPRISES

NO credit card fees!!

Rock River LAR-15 Tactical Operator 2

BRAND NEW! Rock River Arms LAR-15 Tactical Operator 2
Quad rail aluminum free float forend
Chromed bolt carrier group
RRA Tactical muzzle brake
ERGO Sure Grip pistol grip
Comes with 2 - Mil spec 30rd magazines
Flat top with removable stand alone adjustable rear slight
Collapsible Rock River adjustable stock
5.56mm, 1/9 twist, chrome lined
RRA 2 stage trigger
Hard sided case



ABOUT US
We are a new FFL dealer located in Central Ohio. For years we have been selling holsters and other various accessories, but we are now excited to begin selling to you all of your favorite AR style rifles and semi-auto pistols. If you are looking for a particular gun that we do not have listed, please feel free to contact us and we will try our best to help you find it.

OUR POLICIES
Payment
Visa, MasterCard, Discover credit cards accepted with no additional fees. Payment can be made through the auction sites shopping cart, if available. If not, we will send a link to our website's Auction/classified Listing Payment link, so that you can make a secure credit card payment.
NO ADDITIONAL FEES for credit card payments. In fact, we encourage it because it is safer and more secure for all parties involved 
Ohio residents will be charged 7.0% sales tax

Transactions requiring FFL's
Please have your FFL dealer fax or email a signed, legible copy within 5 days of the purchase to us
Make sure the FFL holder includes your name on the fax or email
We will include a copy of our FFL with the shipment

Shipping
We will ship handguns via USPS Priority mail, other items may vary
All shipments of firearms will be insured and tracking number will be provided
Shipping fee for rifles will be marked individually 
Will not ship to  MD, NY, NJ, Washington DC, or other areas where items are not legal to own
Shipping price is for lower 48, extra fee for Alaska and Hawaii
It is the buyer's responsibility to make sure the item purchased is legal in their area
We WILL ship to CA if the item is on the approved list and meets the state's requirements. Shipping times may increase by a couple days due to the additional paperwork required.

Warranties/Returns
New firearms carry the warranty from the manufacturer
Used firearms are sold As Is
If for some reason you believe the item you received is not as we represented, please contact us. We want you to be happy with your purchase!
Trades
We do not routinely accept trades, but on rare occasions we will consider them
Terms will be worked out through email/phone prior to any shipments
Once terms are agreed upon by both parties, we will send a copy of our FFL to your licensed dealer. Your dealer will ship your firearm to us. Once we receive your firearm, we will then ship the agreed upon product to your FFL dealer.

Questions
We strongly encourage you to contact us if you have any questions regarding an item you may wish to purchase. We want to make sure you have confidence in your purchase.
Our products are also for sale locally and we reserve the right to end the sale/auction early as long as there are no bids over any set reserve price.
New gun listings may use stock photos. Serial numbers in pictures may not be the same as the gun shipped.


THANKS AND HAPPY BUYING!!

This medium/heavy weight West German parka is a stylish military jacket.
The parka has a non-detachable hood with adjustable drawstrings to maximize comfort.

Below is everything I could think of anyone might want to ask.  If you have any other questions let me know and I'll answer them.  I prefer to trade for guns because they take up less room. I can deliver within reason, I live in Scottsville and work everyday in Bowling Green.

http://www.flickr.com//photos/42682820@N07/sets/REDACTED1044840/show/



Here is the back story on the mower.

1. I'm getting rid of it because my neighbor and I went in on a Dixie Chopper mower and I don't need this one anymore

2. I bought it in 2006 and used it every year up until 2010 when I bought the new mower.  Since 2010 It's been stored inside on a concrete floor.  From 2006 to 2010 it was stored under a carport on gravel.  The guy I bought it from kept it in a barn.

3. I've hung on to this one because I've seen them repainted and they look sharp, I refinish guns for a hobby so I thought I'd eventually get around to repainting this.  In the last 2.5 years my wife and I have had two kids.  It is now very obvious it will be years before I get around to repainting this mower.

4. During the time I owned it I made one significant repair, in either 2009 or 2010 I had a local guy rebuild the carburetor.  Other than that one oil change per year and blades sharpened once in a while.

5. Up for trade are the:
The SS12 Tractor-Model #917.65370 Serial #1260
The Deck 54"-Model #917.253161
The Plow- Model #917.251382
Two extra rear wheels with AG tires (tires are no good)
Two sets of tire chains
Four wheel weights
One extra mule drive
6. The pulley cover for the engine is in my shed.  I took a picture of it and the extra mule drive but I don't remember why it isn't on the mower.
7. Known problems:
It has not been started for two years, I'm sure the battery is dead and the fuel will have to be drained.
The left front tire isn't holding air.
There is surface rust on most of it.  There are no soft spots and the only scaling rust is a little on the plow and it isn't very deep.  
I'm sure it will need anything any other mower would need that hasn't been started in that long

title: For Sale/Trade:  Mini-14 CQB Custom and extras
postcontent:
I love Mini-14s and can't stand cookie cutter firearms, so I have built this one of a kind Mini-14, Let's call it a CQB. Face to Face sale or ship to FFL at your expense only. Postal money order or cash.

Here's what it is:
Stainless steel Mini-14, early 580 series Ranch Rifle
Archangel Sparta stock system
three Ruger 20 round magazines, one generic (nickle)

Gunsmith work performed includes trigger job (~3.5lb) w/ over-travel screw,
shorten barrel to ~16.125" & re-crown w/ 11* target crown,
barrel threaded for flash hider and Troy flash hider installed,

$1200 gets the base rifle with the work described already completed. Alan Tillman at ART Enterprises did the trigger and muzzle work. He is the best, bar none. It shoots under 1.5 MOA on cheap ammo, 1 MOA on match ammo, maybe better on handloads? This is eadliy a $1500 rifle. Offers never hurt, but price is pretty firm. Trades may be considered, see below. 

Sights shown in the picture can be included at extra cost. They are a C-MORE ATAC red dot reflex sight (aluminum chassis w/ A2 rear sight) $350; and Mag-Pul MBUS front sight, $40. The QD sling may also be included for $35. These will only be sold with the rifle.

I also have several extra Mini-14 & Mini-30 parts: Sythetic stock, $40; Walnut stock w/ Ruger handguard, w/ blue & stainless hardware, $100; and one Amega Ranges picatinny fore-end (best way to put optics on a wood stock), $200.

title: For Sale:  Extra Long (XL) 1.5" Ruger LCP 380 Grip Extension Free shipping
postcontent:
Free shipping!!!!

Product Features:

1.25" Long Magazine Extension For The Ruger LCP .380

First Grip To Accomodate All Three Fingers OF A Man's Hand

Helps To Reduce Painful Kickback When Shooting.

Still Fits Nicely In An Average Pocket And Helps Prevent Shifting In Pocket.

This Product Does Not Increase Magazine Capacity.

A Little Background......

Every after market grip extension I ran across only fit 2 to 2 1/2 fingers. Seeing I couldn't find an extension that fit anywhere on the market, I designed my own. With 2 years in planning, design and development of injection molds for 8 different small caliber models, I'm now selling the best grip extension for the money on Ebay to recoup the cost and maybe receive some of the fruits for my labor! I didn't skimp on design, tolerances or quality of materials. They fit all my fingers perfectly now and they look and perform great! I think you will agree.

Now for the design features: Because of the 1.25" long grip, I now have better control which helps me to be more accurate and feeling more secure that I am more efficient for me and those around me. Second, because of a longer more evenly distributed grip handle, the kick no longer hurts my hand in the cradle area between the thumb and forefinger.

What else is there? There's one more thing. When I carry in my pocket holster, the longer than average grip extension stabilizes the position of the handle so it won't shift to a position that makes it hard to pull out. It stays just where I put it instead of the handle migrating to the side or even bottom of my pocket. This wasn't something that I designed into the product. It just happened to be a benefit I discovered by accident when I started using the new grip. Results may vary for you. I am bigger than the average bear and I wear relaxed fit jeans. This makes it very easy to conceal "For Me". You need to figure out your own methods.

This product does not increase magazine capacity.

Garrison Grip

Selling my Kodiak Outdoors compound hunting with and accessories. It has a fully adjustable draw length of 26.5"-30.5" and adjustable draw weight of 60-70lbs. I shall be including all accessories I have for it at the moment, including:
Fiber optic 5 prong front sight and peep sight
Whisker Biscuit 3 stand arrow rest
4 Golden Tip carbon arrows 
1 6 arrow leg quiver
1 forearm guard
2 trigger releases
1 bowfishing reel
1 bowfishing arrow
1 steel string clasp
6 100 grain blunt arrowheads (for small game hunting)
5 100 grain judo arrowheads (for small game hunting/plinking)
~12 100 grain field points (for plinking/practicing)
4 100 grain Muzzy four-blade broadheads (for medium/large game hunting)
1 hard case (it's really the only beat-up item in the package. I have had it for three bows and 11 years)
Misc accessories (arrow nocks, seats, glue, string wax, string dampeners etc)
1 used yard target (faded, but definetly has another seasons worth of use it in. Can be shot with both field points and broadheads)

All in all, this is a great starters kit for those who would like to get into archery/bow hunting/fishing, and are on a budget. All that is needed for the bowfishing rig is a $10 attachment from Sportsmans Warehouse. Price is negotiable, and will accept trades, especially for a bolt/lever action or handgun. Accessories pictured are only some of what is included. Email or text REDACTED if interested.

title: For Sale:  Concealed Carry Class (Taught by Police Officer) - Aug 04
postcontent:
Cash / Check / Credit Cards Accepted

Kansas CCH Class August 04, 2012 (Saturday)
Taught by active, full time Police Officer
Teaching CCH since 2007

I have real-world experience and teach from that perspective. I add to the basic curriculum to help better prepare students for the challenges of concealed carry and the
potential use of deadly force.

We cover CCH law, Use of Force, Basic Marksmanship, Care and Maintenance, Weapon Selection, Holster Selection, Methods of Carry, Armed Response / Self Defense, Interaction with Law Enforcement and much more.

This is an excellent class taught by a knowledgeable instructor with a bit more than the AG CCH Instructor certification.

Full Time Police Officer
Certified CCH Instructor
NRA Instructor
Self Defense / Armed Response Instructor
Taser Instructor
30 years of experience

Many instructors base there classes on things learned in books and pseudo tactical as seen on TV
My instruction is based on proven and experienced technique and instruction

If you are considering a CCH class just ask yourself: Do you want to learn from someone with true experience in armed conflict, or a used car salesman who decided to teach CCH?

I have the opportunity to interact with many CCH holders and have found that many times the information they received was inaccurate and sometimes dangerous.

I believe in CCH and that is why I teach. IF you are wanting to carry a firearm, just be sure you ask questions of your instructor; their philosophy and true credentials. It is easy to become a CCH instructor, but it takes experience in armed conflict to offer what is really required.

Contact me via email with questions or check my website (partially under construction); www.tacticalcch.com

Email or call 788-4696 / 655-6461 cell.

title: For Sale/Trade:  Very Rare Win. M-37 20 ga. 32" Barrel!!!!
postcontent:
I have an apparently next to nonexistant older model Winchester Model 37 single shot, break action shotgun. 
These were very popular & inexpensive, yet very well built guns favored by younger shooters, farmers, & guys with gun racks in their trucks...back in the day when you could do that stuff.
 These guns were made for many years since being introduced in 1937 & came in .410/16/20/& 12 ga.- & If you have one in 28 ga. please call me!
 I've had several of these over the years & still have a couple around. They were made in different styles, and can best be dated by these changes as this was before serial #'s were required & the Gubmint had real jobs (for the most part). 
 Many were made in 12 ga. & the 'Long Tom' or 'Goose Gun' 32" barrels are kinda rare on the 12's but can be found. But try finding a 20 ga. with a 32" Barrel! 
 The closest I've ever come to locating another one was some  annecdotal 'evidence' (from a guy that should know),  who once told me that he saw one once in @ Tulsa a gun show.
 A good friend that owns New Mexico's largest gun shop for over 40 yrs. ain't never seen one...& he gets EVERYTHING! The back room is a freaking Museum!
 Seems there are more Extraterrestrial Unicorn Jockies around than long barreled Winchester 20 gauge Model 37's....(Especially since they started a Union).
 So if any of you Old Codgers (or even 'Next Generation' Codgers), Winchester Collectors/Ex-Employees, Farmers with 'Widecab' GunRax, Skeet Shooters, Powder Monkeys, (Girl;) Strippers, or anyone else out there have any info or interest in this so far unfound in any catalog or reference ol' 20 ga. - Please drop me a line.
 If you think I need to sell it to you or you want to trade something else that's cool-....then that's cool too. 
 Warning: I can be pretty stubborn & sure don't need it gone but I really like old S&Dubyas. Or silver's good too. Oh, a 1911 might work too....Aah, just Email me. 
  I'm happy to send detailed photos/info to interested parties.
 Gun is original; not the early 'Pigtail' lever but the 2nd type lever/hammer (40's/50's style), has the old style WRA butt plate, regular M37 'Steelbuilt' barrel adress, great bore, brass bead front sight, nice walnut stock/forearm, is in typical used but not abused condition, nothing too remarkable....but that looong barrel!

title: For Sale:  30 M1 Carbine
postcontent:
For sale is a Universal 30 Caliber M1 Carbine.
Rifle has all parts including 2@ 15 round magazines, the sling and oiler.
Also included is one 30 round USGI magazine.

Rifle shows age in bluing and on the stock, but is 100% functional.
It has only been 18 months since I did a full strip down, rebuilt the bolt (if you have ever worked on an M1 bolt you know what that entails!) and replaced most springs.

I'll also throw in a new box of Remington 110 gr SP ammo.
I am an avid reloader of over 30 calibers so I prefer to use low power ammo when plinking and save the full load ammo for hunting.
I'll probably never hunt with a 30 carbine, but the kicker is that being a southpaw the brass from my reduced power loads ding me in the forehead.
Factory ammo does as expected and flies over my shoulder no matter which hand I shoot with.
My safe is too full, so it is time for this one to move on to a new home.
The M1 Carbine is a lot of fun and I hope whoever purchases this enjoys it as much as I and everyone who handled her have had!

I will require proof of residency by Drivers License or State Identification card and will provide a bill of sale (copies for each).

title: For Sale:  XDm 3.8 Compact 45acp
postcontent:
I have an XDm 3.8 Compact in 45 acp. Standard finish, has Trijicon HD night sights on the gun but can have the gunsmith swap the OEM sights back if you so desire. 

I paid $649.00 + Tax at B&T late winter or early spring, added the night sights for about $125.00.


XDm w/ OEM sights $550.00

XDm w/ Trjicon HD's $675.00


Either way I'll include all the original XDm gear and case, the OEM 9rd & 13rd mags.

I also have an additional two mags, 1-10rd from an XD compact, 1-13 rd fullsize mag. I'll sell these for an additional $40.00

Gun runs great with all various JHP loads I tried, No scratches in the finish etc, one small holster wear mark which I can't even pick up in a photo. The compact 45 acp XDm's are pretty tough to come by hence the higher price than the 9mm's & 40's. 

Not really looking for trades right now except maybe a Remington 870 12 gauge with a 28" barrel + cash.
